page.title: 08Morwenstow-A Farmer's Day
page.content: At 10:00 we dipped the sheep to kill the fleas. We dipped the rams first. They were dipped for one minute, being pushed under and cleaned all over. They did not like it very much. Then, they went into a place to dry while the others were being done. Some lambs who were not supposed to be dipped tried to go with them and had to be separated. Then the dipped sheep went into a separate field. Two lambs born today were taken down after lunch with some injured sheep to the others. There were five horses on the farm. In three weeks they are taking a horse to a show and Jeremy practised plaiting the horse's mane. Then he put the horses into a field. I rode on another horse. In the evening the farmer fed the calves and milked the cows. by{Susan Clarke, aged 8
